speaker: CAPULET
content: Capulet orders his servant to invite all the guests on the list and then tells another servant to hire twenty skilled cooks.

speaker: SECOND SERVANT
content: The servant assures Capulet that he will test the cooks by seeing if they can lick their fingers, implying he will hire only competent ones.

speaker: CAPULET
content: Capulet questions how licking fingers can serve as a test of the cooks' skill.

speaker: SECOND SERVANT
content: The servant explains that a bad cook cannot lick his own fingers, so he will not hire anyone who fails this test.

speaker: CAPULET
content: Capulet dismisses the servant to carry out the task.

speaker: NURSE
content: The Nurse confirms that Juliet has gone to Friar Laurence.

speaker: CAPULET
content: Capulet hopes the Friar might help Juliet, then calls her a stubborn, willful girl just as she enters.

speaker: NURSE
content: The Nurse points out Juliet returning from confession with a cheerful expression.

speaker: CAPULET
content: Capulet addresses Juliet as headstrong and asks where she has been wandering.

speaker: JULIET
content: Juliet says she has learned to repent disobeying her father and has been directed by Friar Laurence to beg his pardon, promising future obedience.

speaker: CAPULET
content: Overjoyed, Capulet orders someone to fetch Count Paris and announces the wedding will take place tomorrow morning.

speaker: JULIET
content: Juliet claims she met Paris at the Friar's cell and showed him appropriate affection without overstepping modesty.

speaker: CAPULET
content: Capulet expresses his happiness, insists on seeing Paris immediately, and praises Friar Laurence for helping the whole city.

speaker: JULIET
content: Juliet asks the Nurse to come to her room and help choose suitable clothes and accessories for the wedding tomorrow.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
content: Lady Capulet objects, saying there is enough time before Thursday, the original wedding date.

speaker: CAPULET
content: Capulet overrules his wife, telling the Nurse to go with Juliet and confirming the wedding is moved to tomorrow.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
content: She worries they are running short on supplies for the wedding feast and notes that night is approaching.

speaker: CAPULET
content: He dismisses her concern, promising to take charge and ensure everything is ready. He tells his wife to help Juliet prepare, while he stays up to manage the household and visit Paris to finalize wedding plans. He feels relieved because Juliet has stopped resisting the marriage.
